abstract: Editorial contends the conviction of Hughie Stover, safety director at Upper Big Branch mine, should give momentum to Congress to pass a raft of safety reforms; notes some worthy proposals would protect miners from retaliation for daring to complain about workplace risks like those that led to tragedy at Upper Big Branch.
snippet: The conviction of a safety director at the Upper Big Branch mine should give momentum to Congress to pass a raft of needed safety reforms.
lead_paragraph: The conviction of a safety director at the Upper Big Branch mine should give momentum to Congress to pass a raft of needed safety reforms.
